# Interval Estimation

## One Sample T-Interval

### Estimation Formula

$$ E = t_{1-\alpha^*, n-1} \cdot \frac{s}{\sqrt{n}} $$

* $E$ = the margin of error
* $\alpha^*$ = the one or two sided significance level (1 - Confidence)
* $s$ = the standard deviation
* $n$ = the sample size

### Guidelines on Parallel Processing

```{r}
data(sleep)

#* Margin of Error
(sleep$extra[sleep$group == 1] %>%
  t.test %$%
  conf.int %>%
  diff) / 2

#* Standard Deviation
sd(sleep$extra[sleep$group == 1])

  interval_t1(E = 1.27978, #seq(1, 5, by = 0.01),

              alpha = NULL, #alpha = 0.95, #c(0.80, 0.85, 0.90, 0.95),
              two_tail = c(FALSE, TRUE))
```
